intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion alexandri-borzae, commonly known as Alexandri's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species in certain regions of Europe.
